cigServers.name: cigServers
cigServers.contactinfo: Avaya Customer Services Postal: Avaya, Inc. 211 Mt Airy Rd. Basking Ridge, NJ 07920 USA Tel: +1 908 953 6000 WWW: http://www.avaya.com
cigServers.description: This module defines an interface configure Servers as Tftp and Dhcp servers. Copyright notice: This AVAYA SNMP Management Information Base Specification (Specification) embodies AVAYA confidential and Proprietary intellectual property. AVAYA retains all Title and ownership in the Specification, including any revisionsIt is AVAYA's intent to encourage the widespread use of this Specification in connection with the management of AVAYA products. AVAYA grants vendors, end-users, and other interested parties a non-exclusive license to use this Specification in connection with the management of AVAYA products.This Specification is supplied 'as is', and AVAYA makes no warranty, either express or implied, as to the use, operation, condition, or performance of the Specification.

cigTftpServersDownloadFailureTrap.name: cigTftpServersDownloadFailureTrap
cigTftpServersDownloadFailureTrap.description: Trap based on TFTP client failure to download file from gateway TFTP server. The Error code message strings are according RFC 1350: 0 Not defined 1 File not found. 2 Access violation. 3 Disk full or allocation exceeded. 4 Illegal TFTP operation. 5 Unknown transfer ID. 6 File already exists. 7 No such user.

cigTftpServersUploadFailureTrap.name: cigTftpServersUploadFailureTrap
cigTftpServersUploadFailureTrap.description: Trap based on TFTP client failure to upload file to gateway TFTP server. The Error code message strings are according RFC 1350: 0 Not defined 1 File not found. 2 Access violation. 3 Disk full or allocation exceeded. 4 Illegal TFTP operation. 5 Unknown transfer ID. 6 File already exists. 7 No such user. please note that the gateway TFTP server prevents uploading files to the device using TFTP client, pnly downloading files from the device. The upload files to the gateway TFTP server is by using LOAD-MIB.

cigTftpServersMode.name: cigTftpServersMode
cigTftpServersMode.description: Enable Tftp Server in the device. Default = False (Disable).

cigTftpServersResetStatCounters.name: cigTftpServersResetStatCounters
cigTftpServersResetStatCounters.description: reset (1) - Reset the TFTP Server Statistics. This object should be treated as write-only.

cigTftpServersTotalBytesUsedInNvram.name: cigTftpServersTotalBytesUsedInNvram
cigTftpServersTotalBytesUsedInNvram.description: Number of bytes used in nvram. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersTotalBytesCapacityInNvram.name: cigTftpServersTotalBytesCapacityInNvram
cigTftpServersTotalBytesCapacityInNvram.description: Number of bytes capacity in nvram. Default = 131072.

cigTftpServersTotalBytesUsedInRam.name: cigTftpServersTotalBytesUsedInRam
cigTftpServersTotalBytesUsedInRam.description: Number of bytes used in ram. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersTotalBytesCapacityInRam.name: cigTftpServersTotalBytesCapacityInRam
cigTftpServersTotalBytesCapacityInRam.description: Number of bytes capacity in ram. Default = 20971520.

cigTftpServersSuccessfulDownloads.name: cigTftpServersSuccessfulDownloads
cigTftpServersSuccessfulDownloads.description: Number of tftp successful downloads. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersNotDefinedErrors.name: cigTftpServersNotDefinedErrors
cigTftpServersNotDefinedErrors.description: Number of tftp errors not defined - Error code==0. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersFileNotFoundErrors.name: cigTftpServersFileNotFoundErrors
cigTftpServersFileNotFoundErrors.description: Number of tftp errors of file not found - Error code == 1. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersAccessViolationErrors.name: cigTftpServersAccessViolationErrors
cigTftpServersAccessViolationErrors.description: Number of tftp errors of Access violation - Error code == 2. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersDiskFullErrors.name: cigTftpServersDiskFullErrors
cigTftpServersDiskFullErrors.description: Number of tftp errors of disk full - Error code == 3. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersIllegalTFTPOperationErrors.name: cigTftpServersIllegalTFTPOperationErrors
cigTftpServersIllegalTFTPOperationErrors.description: Number of tftp errors of illegal TFTP operation - Error code == 4. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersUnknownTransferIdErrors.name: cigTftpServersUnknownTransferIdErrors
cigTftpServersUnknownTransferIdErrors.description: Number of tftp errors of unknown transfer Id - Error code == 5. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersFileAlreadyExistsErrors.name: cigTftpServersFileAlreadyExistsErrors
cigTftpServersFileAlreadyExistsErrors.description: Number of tftp errors of file already exists - Error code == 6. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersNoSuchUserErrors.name: cigTftpServersNoSuchUserErrors
cigTftpServersNoSuchUserErrors.description: Number of tftp errors of no such user - Error code == 7. Default = 0.

cigTftpServersDownloadTimeouts.name: cigTftpServersDownloadTimeouts
cigTftpServersDownloadTimeouts.description: Number of tftp downloads timeouts. Timeouts occurs when ACK packets from client to Server did not reach the server.

cigTftpServersNotificationClientIpAddr.name: cigTftpServersNotificationClientIpAddr
cigTftpServersNotificationClientIpAddr.description: The TFTP client IP address. Default = 0.0.0.0

cigTftpServersNotificationFilename.name: cigTftpServersNotificationFilename
cigTftpServersNotificationFilename.description: The filename that the TFTP client tried to upload/download. Default = ''

cigTftpServersNotificationErrorString.name: cigTftpServersNotificationErrorString
cigTftpServersNotificationErrorString.description: The error string relevant to the Error occured during the last upload/download operation. Default = ''

cigDhcpServersClientConflictDetectionTra.name: cigDhcpServersClientConflictDetectionTrap
cigDhcpServersClientConflictDetectionTra.description: DHCP IP address conflict detection. This trap is based on: 1. DHCP server send Ping packets before allocating new IP address. 2. The Client Decline Packets after the client sent gratuitous Arp and get response.

cigDhcpServersServerNacksTrap.name: cigDhcpServersServerNacksTrap
cigDhcpServersServerNacksTrap.description: Server refusal to extend lease or for other clients requests.

cigDhcpServersNoIpAddressLeft.name: cigDhcpServersNoIpAddressLeft
cigDhcpServersNoIpAddressLeft.description: Notification for no IP address left for specific network.

cigDhcpServersMode.name: cigDhcpServersMode
cigDhcpServersMode.description: Enable Dhcp Server in the device. Default = False (Disable).

cigDhcpServersResetStatCounters.name: cigDhcpServersResetStatCounters
cigDhcpServersResetStatCounters.description: reset (1) - Reset the DHCP Server Statistics. This object should be treated as write-only.

cigDhcpServersPingDetectionMode.name: cigDhcpServersPingDetectionMode
cigDhcpServersPingDetectionMode.description: Enable Dhcp Server sending one ping packet in order to detect IP address conflict. Default = False (Disable).

cigDhcpServersPingDetectionTimeout.name: cigDhcpServersPingDetectionTimeout
cigDhcpServersPingDetectionTimeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds of the ping packet send by the DHCP server to detect IP address conflict before allocating new IP address. The user can lower this timeout in case the hosts that recieved IP addresses are on the LAN. Otherwise if the hosts are on the WAN side then the timeout shall be higher the LAN. default 500 milliseconds

cigDhcpServersPoolEntry.name: cigDhcpServersPoolEntry
cigDhcpServersPoolEntry.description: The pool general configuration table entry.

cigDhcpServersPoolIndex.name: cigDhcpServersPoolIndex
cigDhcpServersPoolIndex.description: The Pool Index. G250/G350 - Up to 20 Pools are allowed.

cigDhcpServersPoolStartIPAddr.name: cigDhcpServersPoolStartIPAddr
cigDhcpServersPoolStartIPAddr.description: The Start IP Address of the pool. Default = 0.0.0.0. Stop IP address shall be large or equal to start IP address. The user shall be aware that for G350/G250 the number of IP addresses to be allocated in up to 256 IPs total in all the pools. Also if the user wants to completely change the start IP address/end IP address then the pool shall be Disabled and then by setting both these addresses (start/end) to default the user can set the new values. No need to erase the configuration of the pool for this case (I.e. in order not to loose all the DHCP options configuration). The user is not able to ocnfigure pools with overlapped IP addresses. StartIPaddress can be configured different than EndIPAddress only when Client identifier is not set.

cigDhcpServersPoolEndIPAddr.name: cigDhcpServersPoolEndIPAddr
cigDhcpServersPoolEndIPAddr.description: The End IP Address of the pool. Default = 0.0.0.0. End IP address shall be large or equal to start IP address. The user shall be aware that for G350/G250 the number of IP addresses to be allocated in up to 256 IPs total in all the pools. Also if the user wants to complete change the start IP address/end IP address then the pool shall be Disabled and then by setting both these addresses (start/end) to default the user can set the new values. No need to erase the configuration of the pool for this case (I.e. in order not to loose all the DHCP options configuration). The user is not able to ocnfigure pools with overlapped IP addresses. EndIPaddress can be configured different than StartIPAddress only when Client identifier is not set.

cigDhcpServersPoolMode.name: cigDhcpServersPoolMode
cigDhcpServersPoolMode.description: Enable Dhcp Pool in the device. Default = False (Disable,Inactive). It is recommended to enable/activate the pool only after the user configures all the DHCP pool parameters. The user can changes the parameters when the pool is Enable/active. However part of the clients will have different configuration. After enabling the user will Disable the pool only before deleting it or keeping its ocnfiguration for later use. In Disable mode the binding information is lost. The user can not activate pool with start-ip-addr or end-ip-addr == 0.0.0.0.

cigDhcpServersPoolName.name: cigDhcpServersPoolName
cigDhcpServersPoolName.description: Name of this Pool. Pool Default Name: 'Dhcp Pool #Pool Number'

cigDhcpServersPoolClientID.name: cigDhcpServersPoolClientID
cigDhcpServersPoolClientID.description: Client identifier used for manual leased. The strcuture of the client identifier is as follows: combination of TYPE and Data. Where Type = 01 if for Ethernet MACs and Data for this case if Ethernet MAC address. Default: '' - Null String. In this case no client identifier is defined. ClientIdentifier can only configured when cigDhcpServersPoolStartIPAddr is equal to cigDhcpServersPoolEndIPAddr.

cigDhcpServersPoolLeaseTime.name: cigDhcpServersPoolLeaseTime
cigDhcpServersPoolLeaseTime.description: The Pool leased time in seconds. Infinite is defined as 0xffffffff. default 691200 seconds = 8 days.

cigDhcpServersPoolBootFile.name: cigDhcpServersPoolBootFile
cigDhcpServersPoolBootFile.description: BootFile Field in the Dhcp packet. Default Null String.

cigDhcpServersPoolNextServer.name: cigDhcpServersPoolNextServer
cigDhcpServersPoolNextServer.description: Next Server Field in the Dhcp Packet. Default = 0.0.0.0

cigDhcpServersPoolSubnetMask.name: cigDhcpServersPoolSubnetMask
cigDhcpServersPoolSubnetMask.description: Subnet Mask is Dhcp option 1. Default = 255.255.255.0 There is no ability to configure this option in the general option table.

cigDhcpServersPoolDefaultGateway.name: cigDhcpServersPoolDefaultGateway
cigDhcpServersPoolDefaultGateway.description: Default Gateway is Dhcp option 3. Default = '' = Null String. The format of the string can be up to 8 IP addresses, for exapmle: '121.23.1.12 135.64.13.190 192.123.242.230' There is no ability to configure this option in the general option table.

cigDhcpServersPoolDnsServer.name: cigDhcpServersPoolDnsServer
cigDhcpServersPoolDnsServer.description: DNS Server is Dhcp option 6. Default = '' = Null String. The format of the string can be up to 8 IP addresses, for exapmle: '121.23.1.12 135.64.13.190 192.123.242.230' There is no ability to configure this option in the general option table.

cigDhcpServersPoolDomainName.name: cigDhcpServersPoolDomainName
cigDhcpServersPoolDomainName.description: DNS Server is Dhcp option 15. Default = Null String The format of the string can be: 'avaya' There is no ability to configure this option in the general option table.

cigDhcpServersPoolServerName.name: cigDhcpServersPoolServerName
cigDhcpServersPoolServerName.description: Optional Server Name. Default Null String.

cigDhcpServersPoolRowStatus.name: cigDhcpServersPoolRowStatus
cigDhcpServersPoolRowStatus.description: Used to create/delete a DHCP pool entry. The following values will be supported: - `active', which indicates that the conceptual row is available for use by the managed device; - `createAndGo', which is supplied by a management station wishing to create a new instance of a conceptual row and to have its status automatically set to active, making it available for use by the managed device; - `destroy', which is supplied by a management station wishing to delete all of the instances associated with an existing conceptual row.

cigDhcpServersPoolGenOptionTable.name: cigDhcpServersPoolGenOptionTable
cigDhcpServersPoolGenOptionTable.description: Dhcp Pool General Option configuration table

cigDhcpServersPoolGenOptionEntry.name: cigDhcpServersPoolGenOptionEntry
cigDhcpServersPoolGenOptionEntry.description: The pool general option configuration table entry. The following option numbers are not configurable: Specific Options defined in the pool table: Option 1 - Subnet Mask Option 3 - Default Gateway Option 6 - Dns Servers Option 15 - Dns Name General Options that are not configurable according RFC2131, 2132: Option 0 - Pad Option Option 50 - Requested IP Address Option 51 - IP address Lease Time Option 52 - Option Overload Option 53 - Message Type Option 54 - Server Identifier Option 55 - Parameter Request List Option 56 - Message Option 57 - Maximum DHCP Message Size Option 58 - Renewal (T1) Time Value Option 59 - Rebinding (T2) Time Value Option 60 - Vendor Class Identifier Option 61 - Client Identifier Option 255 - End Option

cigDhcpServersOptionName.name: cigDhcpServersOptionName
cigDhcpServersOptionName.description: Name of this DHCP option. Option Default Name: 'Option #Option Number'

cigDhcpServersOptionType.name: cigDhcpServersOptionType
cigDhcpServersOptionType.description: The type of the DHCP option: ascii(1) is ASCII String as 'Avaya' hex(2) is HEX String as 'aa:bb:cc:dd:12:34:56' ipAddresses(3) can be array of up to 8 IP addresses with the structure as: '121.23.1.12 135.64.13.190 192.123.242.230' integer(4) - unsigned 32 bits integer word(5) - unsigned 16 bits integer The defaults of cigDhcpServersOptionValue shall be changed according setting the type. If setting Type == ascii(1) then the default is '' If setting Type == hex(2) then the default is '' If setting Type == ipAddresses(3) then the default is '0.0.0.0' If setting Type == integer(4) then the default is '00000000' If setting Type == word(5) then the default is '0000'

cigDhcpServersOptionValue.name: cigDhcpServersOptionValue
cigDhcpServersOptionValue.description: The Value of the DHCP option according the TYPE field. Maximum length is 255B in case of ascii or hex, 145B for ipaddresses, 4B for integer and 2B for word.

cigDhcpServersOptionRowStatus.name: cigDhcpServersOptionRowStatus
cigDhcpServersOptionRowStatus.description: Used to create/delete a DHCP option entry. The following values will be supported: - `active', which indicates that the conceptual row is available for use by the managed device; - `createAndGo', which is supplied by a management station wishing to create a new instance of a conceptual row and to have its status automatically set to active, making it available for use by the managed device; - `destroy', which is supplied by a management station wishing to delete all of the instances associated with an existing conceptual row.

cigDhcpServersPoolVendorSpecificOptionTa.name: cigDhcpServersPoolVendorSpecificOptionTable
cigDhcpServersPoolVendorSpecificOptionTa.description: Dhcp Pool Vendor Specific Option configuration table

cigDhcpServersPoolVendorSpecificOptionEn.name: cigDhcpServersPoolVendorSpecificOptionEntry
cigDhcpServersPoolVendorSpecificOptionEn.description: The pool Vendor Specific option configuration table entry.

cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionIndex.name: cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionIndex
cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionIndex.description: The DHCP Vendor Specific Option Index. G250/G350 - Up to 10 Vendor Specific options are allowed.

cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionName.name: cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionName
cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionName.description: Name of this DHCP Vednor specififc option. Vendor Specific Option Default Name: 'Vendor Specififc Option #Index Number'

cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificClassIdentif.name: cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificClassIdentifier
cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificClassIdentif.description: The vendor specific class identifier which transmit in option 60 by the client. Default is null string

cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionType.name: cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionType
cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionType.description: The type of the DHCP vendor specififc option: ascii(1) is ASCII String as 'Avaya' hex(2) is HEX String as 'aa:bb:cc:dd:12:34:56' The defaults of cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionValue shall be changed according setting the type. If setting Type == ascii(1) then the default is '' If setting Type == hex(2) then the default is ''

cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionValue.name: cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionValue
cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionValue.description: The Value of the DHCP vendor specififc option according the Type field. Maximum length is 255B in case of ascii or hex.

cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionRowSta.name: cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionRowStatus
cigDhcpServersVendorSpecificOptionRowSta.description: Used to create/delete a DHCP Vendor Specific option entry. The following values will be supported: - `active', which indicates that the conceptual row is available for use by the managed device; - `createAndGo', which is supplied by a management station wishing to create a new instance of a conceptual row and to have its status automatically set to active, making it available for use by the managed device; - `destroy', which is supplied by a management station wishing to delete all of the instances associated with an existing conceptual row.

cigDhcpServersBootRequests.name: cigDhcpServersBootRequests
cigDhcpServersBootRequests.description: Number of Boot Requests packets. Default = 0.

cigDhcpServersDhcpDiscovers.name: cigDhcpServersDhcpDiscovers
cigDhcpServersDhcpDiscovers.description: Number of Dhcp Discovers packets. Default = 0.

cigDhcpServersDhcpRequests.name: cigDhcpServersDhcpRequests
cigDhcpServersDhcpRequests.description: Number of Dhcp Requests packets. Default = 0.

cigDhcpServersDhcpDeclines.name: cigDhcpServersDhcpDeclines
cigDhcpServersDhcpDeclines.description: Number of Dhcp Declines packets. Default = 0.

cigDhcpServersDhcpReleases.name: cigDhcpServersDhcpReleases
cigDhcpServersDhcpReleases.description: Number of Dhcp Releases packets. Default = 0.

cigDhcpServersDhcpInforms.name: cigDhcpServersDhcpInforms
cigDhcpServersDhcpInforms.description: Number of Dhcp Informs packets. Default = 0.

cigDhcpServersBootReplies.name: cigDhcpServersBootReplies
cigDhcpServersBootReplies.description: Number of Boot Replies packets. Default = 0.

cigDhcpServersDhcpOffers.name: cigDhcpServersDhcpOffers
cigDhcpServersDhcpOffers.description: Number of Dhcp Offers packets. Default = 0.

cigDhcpServersDhcpAcks.name: cigDhcpServersDhcpAcks
cigDhcpServersDhcpAcks.description: Number of Dhcp Acknowledges packets. Default = 0.

cigDhcpServersDhcpNacks.name: cigDhcpServersDhcpNacks
cigDhcpServersDhcpNacks.description: Number of Dhcp Nacks packets. Default = 0.

cigDhcpServersNotificationIpAddr.name: cigDhcpServersNotificationIpAddr
cigDhcpServersNotificationIpAddr.description: The relevant allocated IP address in DHCP/Bootp packet. Default = 0.0.0.0

cigDhcpServersNotificationClientIdentifi.name: cigDhcpServersNotificationClientIdentifier
cigDhcpServersNotificationClientIdentifi.description: The Client identifier used in the DHCP packet. The strcuture of the client identifier is as follows: combination of TYPE and Data. Where Type = 01 if for Ethernet MACs and Data for this case if Ethernet MAC address. Default: 01000000000000

cigDhcpServersNotificationClientHostName.name: cigDhcpServersNotificationClientHostName
cigDhcpServersNotificationClientHostName.description: This mib item presents the Client Host name as send by client packet in option 12.

cigDhcpServersNotificationConflictDetect.name: cigDhcpServersNotificationConflictDetectionMethod
cigDhcpServersNotificationConflictDetect.description: The method which the DHCP server detect conflict. Using ping message by DHCP server or recieving Decline packet from the client as response to client gratuitous ARP.

cigDhcpServersNotificationPoolNetwork.name: cigDhcpServersNotificationPoolNetwork
cigDhcpServersNotificationPoolNetwork.description: This mib item presents cases where no IP address left for specific network. The network exhausted is the pool start/stop IP address AND subnet mask
